meanings.definition: to insert a tube into a body cavity or organ
meanings.sent1: The doctor intubates the patient's throat to help them breathe.
meanings.sent2: During surgery, the medical team intubates the patient to ensure proper airflow.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy nurse intubates the wrong body part, causing a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: In emergency situations, time intubates the urgency of the medical procedure.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tube snaking into the body cavity intubates itself in my mind.

meanings.definition: to provide artificial respiration by inserting a tube into the trachea
meanings.sent1: The paramedic intubates the unconscious patient to help them breathe.
meanings.sent2: In severe cases of respiratory distress, doctors intubate the patient quickly.
meanings.sent3: The robot intubates the wrong person, leading to a comical misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: Hope intubates the heart with the breath of life in times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the tube sliding into the trachea intubates a sense of urgency in the room.
